intro: Koanophyllon stipuliferum, commonly known as the stipule leaf flax, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a low shrub with silver-green, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and bloom in the spring. Koanophyllon stipuliferum is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, making it a hardy and resilient species.
